message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MA, cs.GT, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) and cooperative games, which are typically studied in the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), multi-agent systems (cs.MA), game theory (cs.GT), and systems and control (cs.SY). The paper proposes a new approach called Shapley Q-value for credit assignment in global reward games, which is a critical problem in MARL. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG, cs.AI, and cs.MA. The paper also introduces a cooperative-game theoretical framework and derives an MARL algorithm, which are relevant to cs.GT and cs.SY.
